intro: Neobesseya cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Neobesseya cubensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
